key_title: Key to the genera of Crassulaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Toelken, H.R.; Jeanes, J.A.; Stajsic, V.
source.title: Crassulaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Toelken, H.R.; Jeanes, J.A.; Stajsic, V. (1996). Crassulaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves alternate, opposite or whorled, with bases free; stamens usually twice as many as petals
Leaves opposite with bases more or less connate; stamens as many as petals
Leaves alternate or rosetted; petals free or fused at base only
Leaves opposite or whorled; petals fused into a tube for at least half their length
Leaves crowded in terminal rosettes; flowers 6–12-merous
Leaves alternate or loosely clustered toward branch-tips; flowers typically 4–5-merous (rarely to 9-merous)
Flowers 4-merous; free portion of petals not or hardly recurved at anthesis
Flowers 5-merous; free portion of petals recurved at anthesis
